intro: Heterocladus caracasanus, commonly known as the Caracasanus sea hare, is a species of sea hare found in the tropical Indo-Pacific region. It belongs to the family Aplysiidae and is characterized by its elongated, soft body covered in a layer of mucus. The plant, more accurately a marine gastropod mollusk, exhibits a distinctive coloration with varying shades of brown and yellow. It is herbivorous, feeding primarily on algae and other marine plants. Heterocladus caracasanus plays a role in marine ecosystems by contributing to the grazing pressure on algal communities.
